Vulnerability.Title: mcelog bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description:
Updated mcelog packages that fix one bug are now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7. The mcelog packages contain a daemon that collects and decodes Machine Check Exception (MCE) data on AMD64 and Intel 64 machines.
This update fixes the following bug:
* Previously, the following warning message was generated when updating the mcelog packages:
warning: %postun(mcelog-3:101-3.9de4924.el7.x86_64) scriptlet failed, exit status 1
The underlying source code has been modified to fix this bug, and updating mcelog now completes successfully without generating the aforementioned warning message. (BZ#1388427)
Users of mcelog are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix this bug.
Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
